## Pre-Workshop Readings

Please review these materials before the workshop begins.

### Required

1. **Introduction to Machine Learning**
   - [A visual introduction to machine learning](http://www.r2d3.us/visual-intro-to-machine-learning-part-1/)
   - Estimated time: 15 minutes

2. **Reproducible Research**
   - Wilson et al. (2017). "Good enough practices in scientific computing." *PLOS Computational Biology*.
   - [Link to paper](https://journals.plos.org/ploscompbiol/article?id=10.1371/journal.pcbi.1005510)
   - Focus on: Sections 1-3

### Recommended

3. **Python for Data Science**
   - [Python Data Science Handbook (free online)](https://jakevdp.github.io/PythonDataScienceHandbook/)
   - Focus on: Chapter 3 (Pandas) and Chapter 5 (Machine Learning)

4. **Agent-Based Modeling**
   - Macal, C.M. and North, M.J. (2010). "Tutorial on agent-based modelling and simulation." *Journal of Simulation*.
   - [Link to paper](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1057/jos.2010.3)

**Case Study Paper:**

- Roe, Y., Lee, S., Kim, C., & Lee, J. (2025). "Drug shortage in South Korea: machine learning-based prediction models and analysis of duration and causal factors." *Frontiers in Pharmacology*, 16, 1608843.
  - [Link to paper](https://doi.org/10.3389/fphar.2025.1608843)
  - *Demonstrates Random Forest with Bayesian optimization for predicting drug shortage duration (62% accuracy) and causes (>70% F1). Top predictors: shortage frequency, import status, alternative drug availability. We replicate this approach in Notebook 05.*
